## ADHD/Executive Functioning {#sec-adhd}

{{< include _10_adhd_text.qmd >}}

```{r}
#| label: data-adhd
# source("data_adhd.R")
library(tidyverse)
library(gt)
library(gtExtras)
library(glue)
library(bwu)

pheno <- "adhd"
df <-readr::read_csv("read_data_scales.csv")
domains <- df$domains
string_representation <- df$scales

# Extract the inner part of the string to get the content inside c(...)
inner_string <- gsub("^.+\"c\\((.*)\\)\"$", "\\1", string_representation)

# Use eval and parse to convert the string into an actual R object
scales <- eval(parse(text = paste("c(", inner_string, ")", sep = "")))

data <- bwu::read_data(pheno = pheno)

data <-
  bwu::filter_data(data,
    domain = domains,
    scale = scales
  )
```

```{r}
#| label: text-adhd-sr
#| cache: true

# Self-report
data_sr <-
  data |>
  dplyr::filter(test == "cefi_sr" | test == "caars_sr") |>
  dplyr::arrange(dplyr::desc(percentile)) |>
  dplyr::distinct(.keep_all = FALSE)

# Flatten the text
bwu::cat_neuropsych_results(data = data_sr, file = "_10_adhd_raw.qmd")
```

```{r}
#| label: text-adhd-or
#| cache: true

# Observer reports
data_or <-
  data |>
  dplyr::filter(test == "cefi_or" | test == "caars_or") |>
  dplyr::arrange(dplyr::desc(percentile)) |>
  dplyr::distinct(.keep_all = FALSE)

# Flatten the text
bwu::cat_neuropsych_results(data = data_or, file = "_10_adhd_raw.qmd")
```

```{r}
#| label: qtbl-adhd-sr
#| dev: tikz
#| fig-process: pdf2png
options(tikzDefaultEngine = "xetex")

grp_adhd <- list( standard_score = c("CEFI Self-Report", "CEFI Observer-Report"), t_score = c("CAARS Self-Report", "CAARS Observer-Report"))
grp_caars <- list( t_score = c( "CAARS Self-Report", "CAARS Observer-Report" ) )
grp_cefi <- list( standard_score = c( "CEFI Self-Report", "CEFI Observer-Report" ) )

# footnotes
fn_standard_score <- gt::md("CEFI: Standard Score: Mean = 100 [50th‰], SD ± 15 [16th‰, 84th‰], lower scores reflect reduced functioning.")
fn_t_score <- gt::md("CAARS: *T* Score: Mean = 50 [50th‰], SD ± 10 [16th‰, 84th‰]; higher scores reflect reduced functioning.")

data <- data_sr
pheno <- "self_report"
table_name <- "table_sr"
fn_standard_score <- fn_standard_score
fn_t_score <- fn_t_score
grp_sr <- list( standard_score = c( "CEFI Self-Report" ), t_score = c( "CAARS Self-Report" ) )
vertical_padding <- 0.10
multiline <- TRUE

# Self-Report
# source(here::here("R", "tbl_gt.R"))
bwu::tbl_gt(
  data = data,
  pheno = pheno,
  table_name = table_name,
  fn_standard_score = fn_standard_score,
  fn_t_score = fn_t_score,
  grp_standard_score = grp_sr[["standard_score"]],
  grp_t_score = grp_sr[["t_score"]],
  dynamic_grp = grp_sr,
  vertical_padding = vertical_padding,
  multiline = multiline
)
```

```{r}
#| label: fig-caars
#| fig-cap: "Attention and executive functions are multidimensional concepts that contain several related processes. Both concepts require self-regulatory skills and have some common subprocesses; therefore, it is common to treat them together, or even to refer to both processes when talking about one or the other."

# data for caars dotplot
pheno <- "caars"
data_caars <- dplyr::filter(data, filename %in% c("caars_sr.csv", "caars_or.csv"))
colors <- NULL
return_plot <- Sys.getenv("RETURN_PLOT")
filename <- "fig_caars.svg"
x <- data_caars$z_mean_subdomain
y <- data_caars$subdomain

# Make dotplot
bwu::dotplot(
  data = data_caars,
  x = x,
  y = y,
  colors = NULL,
  return_plot = return_plot,
  filename = filename
)
```
